skill.name: treatment-plans
skill.description: Generate concise (3-4 page), focused medical treatment plans in LaTeX/PDF format for all clinical specialties. Supports general medical treatment, rehabilitation therapy, mental health care, chronic disease management, perioperative care, and pain management. Includes SMART goal frameworks, evidence-based interventions with minimal text citations, regulatory compliance (HIPAA), and professional formatting. Prioritizes brevity and clinical actionability.
skill.summary: Generate concise (3-4 page), focused medical treatment plans in LaTeX/PDF format for all clinical sp...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, or network exfiltration code detected. Scripts only read local files and generate local reports or templates. No obfuscation, persistence, or remote execution patterns found.

content.value_statement: Writing treatment plans without structure is slow and inconsistent. This skill provides LaTeX templates and validation tools for concise, compliant plans.
actual_capabilities: Provides LaTeX templates for general, rehab, mental health, chronic disease, perioperative, pain, and one page plans
Copies selected templates into a new file with timestamped naming
Checks required sections, HIPAA notice, SMART terms, and placeholders in a plan file
Validates quality indicators such as evidence cues, patient centered language, and medication details
Generates text or visual timelines from plan timeframes using optional matplotlib
Includes a medical LaTeX style package with colored boxes and table styling
limitations: Does not generate clinical decisions or patient specific medical advice
Requires a LaTeX compiler to produce PDFs
Visual timelines require matplotlib to be installed
Does not fetch external guidelines or citations automatically

use_cases.title: Standard care plan
use_cases.description: Draft a concise plan for a common chronic condition with SMART goals and monitoring.

use_cases.title: Rehab program plan
use_cases.description: Build a structured therapy plan with phase goals, milestones, and home exercises.

use_cases.title: Documentation support
use_cases.description: Create compliant treatment plan templates with consistent formatting and checklists.

prompt_templates.title: Start from template
prompt_templates.scenario: Need a general medical plan draft
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a general medical treatment plan template for type 2 diabetes and list the placeholders I must fill.

prompt_templates.title: Run completeness check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check my treatment plan for missing sections, HIPAA notice, SMART criteria, and remaining placeholders.

prompt_templates.title: Create a rehab plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a rehabilitation treatment plan in 3 to 4 pages with SMART goals and a weekly schedule outline.

prompt_templates.title: Generate a timeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract timeline items from my plan and produce a text timeline summary with key phases and appointments.

output_examples.input: Create a one page pain management plan outline for chronic low back pain.
output: Header with diagnosis, date, and de identified patient info
SMART goals with pain score and function targets
Interventions list with medications, PT, and behavioral therapy
Monitoring and red flag escalation criteria

best_practices: Use the one page format for straightforward cases
Replace all bracketed placeholders before sharing
Run completeness and quality checks before finalizing
anti_patterns: Including full patient identifiers in the template
Adding long narrative prose instead of structured sections

faq.question: Which platforms does this work with?
faq.answer: It works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code, and outputs standard LaTeX files.

faq.question: What are the plan length limits?
faq.answer: Defaults target one page or three to four pages, but you can extend when clinically needed.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my workflow tools?
faq.answer: It outputs files you can store in any system and can be validated with the included scripts.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: The scripts read local files only and do not send data over a network.

faq.question: What if a script fails to run?
faq.answer: Check file paths, Python version, and optional dependencies like matplotlib or LaTeX.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic templates?
faq.answer: It includes specialty templates, validation checks, and a medical style package for consistent formatting.
